subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: In simplified and traditional Chinese, the [[目]] component is connected to the horizontal line below it whereas, in Japanese and Korean, [[目]] is separate from that line.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: The [[Kangxi]] dictionary lists 真 as the [[unorthodox]] form ([[俗字]]) of [[眞]]. However, the traditional Kangxi form [[眞]], with [[匕]] on top, is rarely used nowadays. In modern times (except in Korea), 真 is more commonly used in both traditional and simplified Chinese scripts as well as Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|匕|鼎|t1=spoon, fork|t2=ancient food vessel|ls=ic}} – using a fork to fetch food from a cauldron. Alternatively, an ancient variant of {{och-l|貞|divination}}.
